name: Highly selective cancer drug in $360 million development deal
introduction: Hamburgâs Evotec has entered into both a licensing and master service agreement with Australian oncology-focussed biotech Kazia Therapeutics.
content:
Hamburg, Germany-based Evotec (EVT: Xetra) has entered into both a licensing and master service agreement with Australian oncology-focussed biotech Kazia Therapeutics (ASX: KZA).

Under the terms of the deal, Evotec will grant Kazia an exclusive worldwide license for research, development and commercialization of its oncology project EVT801.

EVT801 is a pre-clinical-stage, orally available, small molecule inhibitor of the lymphatic growth factor receptor VEGFR3, originally developed within Evotec's partnership with French pharma major Sanofi (Euronext: SAN).

Highly targeted therapy

The firms believe that VEGFR3 has an advantage over other VEGF receptors, in that it is more selective, thereby potentially avoiding the significant toxicity seen with many such candidates.

The candidate could therefore combine high efficacy both against the primary tumor and lymphatic-borne metastases with a highly favorable toxicology profile.

Kazia is planning to clinically evaluate EVT801 both as a single agent and in combination with immunotherapy in a set of specific oncology indications. 

Evotec will manage a Phase I trial under the full sponsorship of Kazia, with the Australian firm taking responsibility for any subsequent clinical evaluation and commercialisation.

As well as a small upfront payment, Evotec is eligible to receive clinical and commercial milestones of more than 300 million euros ($361 million), as well as tiered high single-digit royalties on the net sales of EVT801, which will be shared with Sanofi.

Kazia chief executive James Garner said: “Evotec have done first-class work in the early development of EVT801, and the pre-clinical data package is exceptionally strong.

He added: “Our intention is to fast track a phase I clinical trial of the drug, which we expect to commence in CY2021."
meta_keywords: Evotec, Kazia, highly, development, million, Australian, deal, selective, clinical, biotech, oncology-focussed, agreement, service, master, licensing, drug
